text: One additional state health care worker has died from COVID-19 and 115 more have been infected with the coronavirus, the California Department of Public Health reported on Tuesday. https://t.co/wHZ1yYlRWE

text: 40 inmates from San Quentin State Prison have been transferred to hospitals around the Bay Area for critical care after testing positive for the coronavirus, according to Marin County health officials. https://t.co/mqwUIhHkPq

name: sfchronicle
text: State officials are urging eligible residents in California to donate blood, saying that donating blood is essential during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/UCEijN9xF4

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Twenty residents at San Miguel Villa nursing home in Concord have died from COVID-19, according to state health data. There were 14 deaths one week ago. In total, 62 residents and 17 health care workers have tested positive. https://t.co/PpkS2F2grL

name: sfchronicle
text:

text:

See more details at our California Fire Map & Tracker: https://t.co/Qvg3F34xSh https://t.co/65W6kzHbUF

name: sfchronicle
text:
That quirky Bernal Heights rock has been repainted yet again ‚Äî but this time, the artist behind its Black Lives Matter message couldn‚Äôt be happier.

It reads ‚ÄúBlack Trans Lives Matter‚Äù with a raised black fist and pink, blue and white stripes.

name: sfchronicle
text: Today, California recorded 7,820 new coronavirus cases, the second highest number of new daily cases. The highest number was recorded on Monday, with 8,196 cases in a day, according to county data compiled by The Chronicle. https://t.co/kSMUgev7Yp
